The resources can be accessed here: Agentic Tool (https://github.com/PrachuryyaKaushik/AWED-FiNER), Web Application (https://hf.co/spaces/prachuryyaIITG/AWED-FiNER), and 49 Expert Detector Models (https://hf.co/collections/prachuryyaIITG/awed-finer).

AI.tldr: AWED-FiNER是一个针对36种全球语言的细粒度命名实体识别（FgNER）的开源生态系统，提供代理工具包、Web应用程序和专家模型，旨在解决低资源语言和FgNER任务中的LLM局限性。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型（LLM）在低资源语言和细粒度NLP任务（如FgNER）方面存在不足，而全球超过66亿人口使用的36种语言FgNER能力缺失，因此需要一个能够覆盖这些语言的解决方案。
AI.method: 该研究引入了AWED-FiNER生态系统，包含代理工具（用于将多语言文本路由到专业模型并快速获取FgNER注释）、Web应用程序（为非技术用户提供即用型FgNER注释服务）以及一系列小型、开源、状态先进的语言特定专家模型（支持离线和边缘设备部署）。
AI.result: AWED-FiNER成功为36种语言（覆盖超过66亿人口，特别关注了Bodo、Manipuri、Bishnupriya和Mizo等弱势语言）提供了FgNER解决方案，并提供了相应的代码库、Web应用链接和专家模型链接。
AI.conclusion: AWED-FiNER生态系统有效地弥补了全球36种语言在FgNER方面的空白，通过提供易于访问的工具和高效的模型，降低了使用门槛，并支持了资源受限环境下的部署。

title: Global Context Compression with Interleaved Vision-Text Transformation
summary: Recent achievements of vision-language models in end-to-end OCR point to a new avenue for low-loss compression of textual information. This motivates earlier works that render the Transformer's input into images for prefilling, which effectively reduces the number of tokens through visual encoding, thereby alleviating the quadratically increased Attention computations. However, this partial compression fails to save computational or memory costs at token-by-token inference. In this paper, we investigate global context compression, which saves tokens at both prefilling and inference stages. Consequently, we propose VIST2, a novel Transformer that interleaves input text chunks alongside their visual encoding, while depending exclusively on visual tokens in the pre-context to predict the next text token distribution. Around this idea, we render text chunks into sketch images and train VIST2 in multiple stages, starting from curriculum-scheduled pretraining for optical language modeling, followed by modal-interleaved instruction tuning. We conduct extensive experiments using VIST2 families scaled from 0.6B to 8B to explore the training recipe and hyperparameters. With a 4$\times$ compression ratio, the resulting models demonstrate significant superiority over baselines on long writing tasks, achieving, on average, a 3$\times$ speedup in first-token generation, 77% reduction in memory usage, and 74% reduction in FLOPS. Our codes and datasets will be public to support further studies.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了VIST2，一种新型Transformer模型，通过将文本块编码为视觉信息并交错处理，实现了文本数据的全局上下文压缩，显著降低了计算和内存成本，并在长文本生成任务上取得了优于基线模型的性能。
AI.motivation: 现有基于Transformer的OCR方法在预训练阶段可以将文本输入编码为图像以减少Token数量，但并未在逐Token推理阶段节省计算和内存成本。这促使研究者探索能够同时在预训练和推理阶段都节省资源的全局上下文压缩方法。
AI.method: 提出VIST2模型，通过将输入文本块渲染成草图图像，并将其视觉编码与原始文本块交错处理。模型仅依赖于视觉Token来预测下一个文本Token的分布。VIST2经过多阶段训练，包括课程学习的预训练（光学语言模型）和模态交错的指令调优。
AI.result: VIST2模型在长文本生成任务上表现出色，达到了4倍的压缩率，平均在首Token生成速度上提升3倍，内存使用减少77%，FLOPS减少74%。作者进行了大规模实验（0.6B到8B参数）以探索训练策略和超参数。
AI.conclusion: VIST2通过全局上下文压缩，成功地在降低计算和内存成本的同时，提高了长文本生成任务的效率和性能，为低损耗文本信息压缩提供了一种有效的新途径。

title: Diagnosing Generalization Failures in Fine-Tuned LLMs: A Cross-Architectural Study on Phishing Detection
summary: The practice of fine-tuning Large Language Models (LLMs) has achieved state-of-the-art performance on specialized tasks, yet diagnosing why these models become brittle and fail to generalize remains a critical open problem. To address this, we introduce and apply a multi-layered diagnostic framework to a cross-architectural study. We fine-tune Llama 3.1 8B, Gemma 2 9B, and Mistral models on a high-stakes phishing detection task and use SHAP analysis and mechanistic interpretability to uncover the root causes of their generalization failures. Our investigation reveals three critical findings: (1) Generalization is driven by a powerful synergy between architecture and data diversity. The Gemma 2 9B model achieves state-of-the-art performance (>91\% F1), but only when trained on a stylistically diverse ``generalist'' dataset. (2) Generalization is highly architecture-dependent. We diagnose a specific failure mode in Llama 3.1 8B, which performs well on a narrow domain but cannot integrate diverse data, leading to a significant performance drop. (3) Some architectures are inherently more generalizable. The Mistral model proves to be a consistent and resilient performer across multiple training paradigms. By pinpointing the flawed heuristics responsible for these failures, our work provides a concrete methodology for diagnosing and understanding generalization failures, underscoring that reliable AI requires deep validation of the interplay between architecture, data, and training strategy.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一个多层次的诊断框架，用于分析大型语言模型（LLM）在特定任务上微调后出现泛化失败的原因。通过对 Llama 3.1 8B、Gemma 2 9B 和 Mistral 模型在网络钓鱼检测任务上的跨架构研究，揭示了架构和数据多样性的协同作用、架构依赖性以及某些架构的内在泛化能力是影响模型泛化的关键因素。
AI.motivation: 当前对大型语言模型进行微调以提升专业任务性能的方法虽取得了SOTA表现，但其脆性（brittleness）和泛化能力不足的问题仍未得到充分诊断和解决，这是一个关键的开放性问题。
AI.method: 采用多层次诊断框架，结合SHAP分析和机制可解释性方法，对在网络钓鱼检测任务上进行微调的 Llama 3.1 8B、Gemma 2 9B 和 Mistral 模型进行跨架构研究。
AI.result: 1. Gemma 2 9B 在使用风格多样的“通才”数据集时，能达到超过91%的F1分数，证明了架构和数据多样性协同作用的重要性。 2. Llama 3.1 8B 存在特定的泛化失败模式，尽管在狭窄领域表现良好，但无法整合多样化数据，导致性能显著下降。 3. Mistral 模型在不同训练范式下均表现出一致且稳健的性能，表明其内在的泛化能力。该研究还指出了导致这些失败的特定错误启发式方法。
AI.conclusion: 泛化能力是架构和数据多样性协同作用的结果，且高度依赖于模型架构。某些模型架构比其他架构具有更强的内在泛化能力。本研究提供了一种具体的诊断和理解泛化失败的方法，强调可靠的人工智能需要深入验证架构、数据和训练策略之间的相互作用。

title: mergetune: Continued fine-tuning of vision-language models
summary: Fine-tuning vision-language models (VLMs) such as CLIP often leads to catastrophic forgetting of pretrained knowledge. Prior work primarily aims to mitigate forgetting during adaptation; however, forgetting often remains inevitable during this process. We introduce a novel paradigm, \emph{continued fine-tuning (CFT)}, which seeks to recover pretrained knowledge after a zero-shot model has already been adapted. We propose a simple, model-agnostic CFT strategy (named MERGETUNE) guided by linear mode connectivity (LMC), which can be applied post hoc to existing fine-tuned models without requiring architectural changes. Given a fine-tuned model, we continue fine-tuning its trainable parameters (e.g., soft prompts or linear heads) to search for a continued model which has two low-loss paths to the zero-shot (e.g., CLIP) and the fine-tuned (e.g., CoOp) solutions. By exploiting the geometry of the loss landscape, the continued model implicitly merges the two solutions, restoring pretrained knowledge lost in the fine-tuned counterpart. A challenge is that the vanilla LMC constraint requires data replay from the pretraining task. We approximate this constraint for the zero-shot model via a second-order surrogate, eliminating the need for large-scale data replay. Experiments show that MERGETUNE improves the harmonic mean of CoOp by +5.6\% on base-novel generalisation without adding parameters. % We show \emph{the first time} superior performance than CLIP on both DTD and EuroSAT, on cross-dataset transfer. On robust fine-tuning evaluations, the LMC-merged model from MERGETUNE surpasses ensemble baselines with lower inference cost, achieving further gains and state-of-the-art results when ensembled with the zero-shot model. Our code is available at \href{https://github.com/Surrey-UP-Lab/MERGETUNE}{https://github.com/Surrey-UP-Lab/MERGETUNE}.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为 MERGETUNE 的持续微调（CFT）范式，旨在恢复已适应的零样本模型（如 CLIP）在微调过程中丢失的预训练知识。MERGETUNE 利用线性模式连通性（LMC）作为指导，通过微调可训练参数（如软提示或线性头）来寻找一个能够隐式融合零样本和微调模型解决方案的持续模型，从而恢复遗忘的知识。该方法无需修改模型架构，并且通过二阶代理消除了对预训练数据的重放需求。
AI.motivation: 传统的视觉-语言模型（VLMs）微调方法会导致预训练知识的灾难性遗忘。现有研究主要致力于减轻微调过程中的遗忘，但遗忘往往难以避免。因此，需要一种在模型已经适应后再恢复预训练知识的范式。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为 MERGETUNE 的持续微调（CFT）策略。该策略利用线性模式连通性（LMC）作为指导，对已微调模型的（软提示或线性头等）可训练参数进行微调，以寻找一个持续模型。该持续模型能够使零样本模型（如 CLIP）和微调模型（如 CoOp）的解决方案具有两个低损失路径。通过利用损失景观的几何特性，持续模型隐式地融合了这两个解决方案，从而恢复了在微调模型中丢失的预训练知识。为解决 LMC 约束需要数据重放的问题， MERGETUNE 使用二阶代理来近似零样本模型的约束，无需大规模数据重放。
AI.result: MERGETUNE 提高了 CoOp 在基础-新颖泛化上的调和平均数 +5.6%，且不增加参数量。在跨数据集迁移任务上，MERGETUNE 首次在 DTD 和 EuroSAT 数据集上取得了优于 CLIP 的性能。在鲁棒微调评估中，MERGETUNE 生成的 LMC 融合模型超越了集成基线，且推理成本更低，当与零样本模型集成时，进一步提升了性能并达到了最先进水平。
AI.conclusion: MERGETUNE 是一种有效且模型无关的 CFT 策略，能够通过隐式融合零样本和微调模型解决方案来恢复预训练知识，克服了传统微调方法中的灾难性遗忘问题，并在多项评估中取得了显著的性能提升。

title: Credit C-GPT: A Domain-Specialized Large Language Model for Conversational Understanding in Vietnamese Debt Collection
summary: Debt collection is a critical function within the banking, financial services, and insurance (BFSI) sector, relying heavily on large-scale human-to-human conversational interactions conducted primarily in Vietnamese contact centers. These conversations involve informal spoken language, emotional variability, and complex domain-specific reasoning, which pose significant challenges for traditional natural language processing systems. This paper introduces Credit C-GPT, a domain-specialized large language model with seven billion parameters, fine-tuned for conversational understanding in Vietnamese debt collection scenarios. The proposed model integrates multiple conversational intelligence tasks, including dialogue understanding, sentiment recognition, intent detection, call stage classification, and structured slot-value extraction, within a single reasoning-based framework. We describe the data construction process, annotation strategy, and training methodology, and evaluate the model on proprietary human-annotated datasets. Experimental results show consistent improvements over traditional pipeline-based approaches, indicating that domain-specialized conversational language models provide a scalable and privacy-aware solution for real-time assistance and post-call analytics in enterprise contact centers.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 Credit C-GPT 的领域专业化大型语言模型，用于理解越南语催收对话。该模型通过集成多种对话智能任务，在催收场景下优于传统方法。
AI.motivation: 传统的自然语言处理系统难以处理越南语催收对话中存在的非正式语言、情感变化和复杂领域知识，BFSI 行业需要更有效的解决方案。
AI.method: 开发了一个包含 70 亿参数的领域专业化大型语言模型 Credit C-GPT，并针对越南语催收对话进行了微调。该模型整合了对话理解、情感识别、意图检测、通话阶段分类和结构化槽值提取等多个任务，并采用基于推理的框架。
AI.result: Credit C-GPT 在专有的人工标注数据集上进行了评估，实验结果显示在多个对话智能任务上均优于传统的基于流水线的方法，证明了其在实时协助和通话后分析方面的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 领域专业化的对话语言模型为企业联络中心提供了可扩展且注重隐私的解决方案，能够有效处理越南语催收对话中的挑战。

title: A Safety Report on GPT-5.2, Gemini 3 Pro, Qwen3-VL, Doubao 1.8, Grok 4.1 Fast, Nano Banana Pro, and Seedream 4.5
summary: The rapid evolution of Large Language Models (LLMs) and Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) has produced substantial gains in reasoning, perception, and generative capability across language and vision. However, whether these advances yield commensurate improvements in safety remains unclear, in part due to fragmented evaluation practices limited to single modalities or threat models. In this report, we present an integrated safety evaluation of 7 frontier models: GPT-5.2, Gemini 3 Pro, Qwen3-VL, Doubao 1.8, Grok 4.1 Fast, Nano Banana Pro, and Seedream 4.5. We evaluate each model across language, vision-language, and image generation settings using a unified protocol that integrates benchmark evaluation, adversarial evaluation, multilingual evaluation, and compliance evaluation. Aggregating our evaluations into safety leaderboards and model safety profiles across multiple evaluation modes reveals a sharply heterogeneous safety landscape. While GPT-5.2 demonstrates consistently strong and balanced safety performance across evaluations, other models exhibit pronounced trade-offs among benchmark safety, adversarial alignment, multilingual generalization, and regulatory compliance. Both language and vision-language modalities show significant vulnerability under adversarial evaluation, with all models degrading substantially despite strong results on standard benchmarks. Text-to-image models achieve relatively stronger alignment in regulated visual risk categories, yet remain brittle under adversarial or semantically ambiguous prompts. Overall, these results show that safety in frontier models is inherently multidimensional--shaped by modality, language, and evaluation scheme, underscoring the need for standardized safety evaluations to accurately assess real-world risk and guide responsible model development and deployment.

AI.tldr: 本研究对7个前沿大语言模型（LLM）和多模态大语言模型（MLLM）进行了综合安全评估，发现在不同模态、语言和评估方案下，模型的安全性能存在显著差异。GPT-5.2在各项评估中表现均衡，而其他模型则在基准安全、对抗性对齐、多语言通用性及合规性之间存在权衡。对抗性评估揭示了语言和视觉-语言模态的显著脆弱性，而文本到图像模型在受管制的视觉风险类别中表现较好，但在对抗性或语义模糊提示下仍然脆弱。
AI.motivation: 现有的大语言模型（LLM）和多模态大语言模型（MLLM）在能力上取得了巨大进步，但其安全性提升程度尚不明确。现有评估方法碎片化，仅限于单一模态或威胁模型，无法全面衡量模型的安全性。
AI.method: 研究者对GPT-5.2、Gemini 3 Pro、Qwen3-VL、Doubao 1.8、Grok 4.1 Fast、Nano Banana Pro和Seedream 4.5这7个模型进行了集成安全评估。评估涵盖了语言、视觉-语言和图像生成三个场景，并采用统一协议，整合了基准评估、对抗性评估、多语言评估和合规性评估。
AI.result: 评估结果显示，模型的安全性存在显著的异质性。GPT-5.2在各项评估中表现出持续且均衡的安全性能。其他模型则在基准安全、对抗性对齐、多语言通用性和监管合规性之间表现出明显的权衡。在对抗性评估中，语言和视觉-语言模态都显示出显著的脆弱性，尽管在标准基准测试中表现良好，模型性能仍大幅下降。文本到图像模型在受管制的视觉风险类别中表现出相对较强的对齐性，但在对抗性或语义模糊的提示下仍然很脆弱。
AI.conclusion: 前沿模型的安全性是多维度的，受到模态、语言和评估方案的影响。这项研究强调了采用标准化的安全评估方法的重要性，以准确评估现实世界的风险，并指导模型负责任的开发和部署。

title: SatMap: Revisiting Satellite Maps as Prior for Online HD Map Construction
comment: This work has been submitted to the IEEE ICPR for possible publication
summary: Online high-definition (HD) map construction is an essential part of a safe and robust end-to-end autonomous driving (AD) pipeline. Onboard camera-based approaches suffer from limited depth perception and degraded accuracy due to occlusion. In this work, we propose SatMap, an online vectorized HD map estimation method that integrates satellite maps with multi-view camera observations and directly predicts a vectorized HD map for downstream prediction and planning modules. Our method leverages lane-level semantics and texture from satellite imagery captured from a Bird's Eye View (BEV) perspective as a global prior, effectively mitigating depth ambiguity and occlusion. In our experiments on the nuScenes dataset, SatMap achieves 34.8% mAP performance improvement over the camera-only baseline and 8.5% mAP improvement over the camera-LiDAR fusion baseline. Moreover, we evaluate our model in long-range and adverse weather conditions to demonstrate the advantages of using a satellite prior map. Source code will be available at https://iv.ee.hm.edu/satmap/.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为SatMap的在线矢量化高清地图估计方法，该方法融合了卫星地图和多视角相机观测，以克服纯相机方法的局限性，并在nuScenes数据集上取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有的在线高清地图构建方法依赖于车载相机，存在深度感知有限和遮挡导致精度下降的问题。作者希望通过融合卫星地图来解决这些限制。
AI.method: SatMap方法利用卫星图像提供的鸟瞰视角（BEV）的车道级语义和纹理信息作为全局先验，结合多视角相机观测，直接预测矢量化高清地图，从而缓解深度歧义和遮挡问题。
AI.result: 在nuScenes数据集上，SatMap比纯相机基线提高了34.8%的mAP，比相机-激光雷达融合基线提高了8.5%的mAP。在长距离和恶劣天气条件下的评估也证明了卫星先验地图的优势。
AI.conclusion: SatMap通过融合卫星地图和相机数据，能够有效构建高清地图，克服了纯相机方法的不足，并在自动驾驶任务中展现出优越的性能，尤其在长距离和恶劣天气条件下优势明显。

title: HOMURA: Taming the Sand-Glass for Time-Constrained LLM Translation via Reinforcement Learning
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) have achieved remarkable strides in multilingual translation but are hindered by a systemic cross-lingual verbosity bias, rendering them unsuitable for strict time-constrained tasks like subtitling and dubbing. Current prompt-engineering approaches struggle to resolve this conflict between semantic fidelity and rigid temporal feasibility. To bridge this gap, we first introduce Sand-Glass, a benchmark specifically designed to evaluate translation under syllable-level duration constraints. Furthermore, we propose HOMURA, a reinforcement learning framework that explicitly optimizes the trade-off between semantic preservation and temporal compliance. By employing a KL-regularized objective with a novel dynamic syllable-ratio reward, HOMURA effectively "tames" the output length. Experimental results demonstrate that our method significantly outperforms strong LLM baselines, achieving precise length control that respects linguistic density hierarchies without compromising semantic adequacy.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种名为HOMURA的强化学习框架，通过引入Sand-Glass基准和动态词语数量奖励，有效解决了大型语言模型在多语言翻译中存在的过度冗长问题，使其适用于字幕制作等对时间有严格要求的任务。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型在多语言翻译中存在普遍的冗长偏见，无法满足字幕制作等对时间有严格限制的任务需求。现有的提示工程方法难以在语义准确性和时间可行性之间取得平衡。
AI.method: 研究者首先创建了一个名为Sand-Glass的基准，用于评估在音节级别时长限制下的翻译质量。然后，他们提出了一个名为HOMURA的强化学习框架，通过KL正则化目标和新颖的动态音节比例奖励来优化语义保留和时间合规性之间的权衡，以控制输出长度。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，HOMURA方法显著优于强大的LLM基线模型，实现了对长度的精确控制，能够尊重语言的密度层级，同时不损害语义的充分性。
AI.conclusion: HOMURA框架能够有效地解决大型语言模型在多语言翻译中的冗长问题，实现严格的时间限制要求，并在保证语义准确性的前提下，提高翻译的实用性，尤其适用于字幕和配音等领域。

title: Defending Large Language Models Against Jailbreak Attacks via In-Decoding Safety-Awareness Probing
summary: Large language models (LLMs) have achieved impressive performance across natural language tasks and are increasingly deployed in real-world applications. Despite extensive safety alignment efforts, recent studies show that such alignment is often shallow and remains vulnerable to jailbreak attacks. Existing defense mechanisms, including decoding-based constraints and post-hoc content detectors, struggle against sophisticated jailbreaks, often intervening robust detection or excessively degrading model utility. In this work, we examine the decoding process of LLMs and make a key observation: even when successfully jailbroken, models internally exhibit latent safety-related signals during generation. However, these signals are overridden by the model's drive for fluent continuation, preventing timely self-correction or refusal. Building on this observation, we propose a simple yet effective approach that explicitly surfaces and leverages these latent safety signals for early detection of unsafe content during decoding. Experiments across diverse jailbreak attacks demonstrate that our approach significantly enhances safety, while maintaining low over-refusal rates on benign inputs and preserving response quality. Our results suggest that activating intrinsic safety-awareness during decoding offers a promising and complementary direction for defending against jailbreak attacks. Code is available at: https://github.com/zyz13590/SafeProbing.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出一种在解码过程中激活和利用大语言模型（LLM）内部潜在安全信号的方法，以更有效地检测和防御越狱攻击，同时保持模型效用。
AI.motivation: 现有LLM的安全对齐通常比较浅层，容易受到越狱攻击。现有的防御机制（如解码约束和后处理检测）在应对复杂越狱时效果不佳，可能导致误判或显著降低模型性能。因此，需要更有效的防御策略。
AI.method: 研究者观察到，即使在被成功越狱的情况下，LLM在生成过程中仍然会产生潜在的安全信号，但这些信号会被继续生成流畅内容的动力所覆盖。基于此，研究提出一种显式地唤醒和利用这些潜在安全信号的方法，在解码过程中进行早期检测，实现对不安全内容的及时干预。
AI.result: 实验表明，该方法在各种越狱攻击下显著提高了LLM的安全性。同时，在面对良性输入时，其误拒率低，并且能够保持响应质量。这表明激活LLM内在的安全意识是一种有效的防御手段。
AI.conclusion: 激活LLM在解码过程中的内在安全意识，是一种有前景且互补的防御越狱攻击的方向，能够有效提升模型的安全性，同时保持其可用性。

title: HUMANLLM: Benchmarking and Reinforcing LLM Anthropomorphism via Human Cognitive Patterns
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in reasoning and generation, serving as the foundation for advanced persona simulation and Role-Playing Language Agents (RPLAs). However, achieving authentic alignment with human cognitive and behavioral patterns remains a critical challenge for these agents. We present HUMANLLM, a framework treating psychological patterns as interacting causal forces. We construct 244 patterns from ~12,000 academic papers and synthesize 11,359 scenarios where 2-5 patterns reinforce, conflict, or modulate each other, with multi-turn conversations expressing inner thoughts, actions, and dialogue. Our dual-level checklists evaluate both individual pattern fidelity and emergent multi-pattern dynamics, achieving strong human alignment (r=0.91) while revealing that holistic metrics conflate simulation accuracy with social desirability. HUMANLLM-8B outperforms Qwen3-32B on multi-pattern dynamics despite 4x fewer parameters, demonstrating that authentic anthropomorphism requires cognitive modeling--simulating not just what humans do, but the psychological processes generating those behaviors.

AI.tldr: 本文提出HUMANLLM框架，通过模拟人类心理模式的因果互动来实现更真实的语言代理行为，并在评估中取得了高度的人类一致性。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLMs）在模拟人类认知和行为模式方面存在挑战，需要更真实的人格模拟。
AI.method: 该研究从大量学术论文中提取244种心理模式，并构建了11,359个包含模式间相互作用（增强、冲突、调节）的场景。通过双层评估方法（个体模式保真度和多模式动态涌现）来衡量模拟的准确性。
AI.result: HUMANLLM在人类一致性评估中达到r=0.91。研究发现，整体性指标会混淆模拟准确性和社会期望性。HUMANLLM-8B在多模式动态方面优于参数量更大的Qwen3-32B。
AI.conclusion: 真实的拟人化需要认知建模，即模拟产生行为的心理过程，而不仅仅是行为本身。HUMANLLM框架证明了这种方法的有效性。

title: BikeActions: An Open Platform and Benchmark for Cyclist-Centric VRU Action Recognition
comment: This work has been submitted to the IEEE ICPR for possible publication
summary: Anticipating the intentions of Vulnerable Road Users (VRUs) is a critical challenge for safe autonomous driving (AD) and mobile robotics. While current research predominantly focuses on pedestrian crossing behaviors from a vehicle's perspective, interactions within dense shared spaces remain underexplored. To bridge this gap, we introduce FUSE-Bike, the first fully open perception platform of its kind. Equipped with two LiDARs, a camera, and GNSS, it facilitates high-fidelity, close-range data capture directly from a cyclist's viewpoint. Leveraging this platform, we present BikeActions, a novel multi-modal dataset comprising 852 annotated samples across 5 distinct action classes, specifically tailored to improve VRU behavior modeling. We establish a rigorous benchmark by evaluating state-of-the-art graph convolution and transformer-based models on our publicly released data splits, establishing the first performance baselines for this challenging task. We release the full dataset together with data curation tools, the open hardware design, and the benchmark code to foster future research in VRU action understanding under https://iv.ee.hm.edu/bikeactions/.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了FUSE-Bike，一个专为从骑行者视角捕捉VRU（弱势道路使用者）交互数据而设计的开源感知平台，并发布了BikeActions数据集和相关基准测试，以填补当前研究在密集共享空间VRU行为建模方面的空白。
AI.motivation: 当前自动驾驶领域对VRU意图预测的研究主要集中在车辆视角下的行人过马路行为，而对骑行者视角下，特别是在密集共享空间中，VRU之间的交互行为研究不足。
AI.method: 研究者开发了FUSE-Bike感知平台，集成了LiDAR、摄像头和GNSS，用于从骑行者视角采集高保真度的近距离数据。在此基础上，构建了BikeActions多模态数据集，包含852个标注样本，涵盖5种不同的动作类别。最后，使用图卷积和Transformer等现有技术在数据集上进行了基准测试。
AI.result: 研究者成功构建了FUSE-Bike平台和BikeActions数据集，并首次为VRU动作理解任务建立了性能基线。发布的数据集、数据整理工具、硬件设计和基准测试代码。
AI.conclusion: FUSE-Bike平台和BikeActions数据集为研究骑行者视角下的VRU行为提供了新的资源，有望推动VRU意图预测和安全自动驾驶技术的发展。

title: SVII-3D: Advancing Roadside Infrastructure Inventory with Decimeter-level 3D Localization and Comprehension from Sparse Street Imagery
summary: The automated creation of digital twins and precise asset inventories is a critical task in smart city construction and facility lifecycle management. However, utilizing cost-effective sparse imagery remains challenging due to limited robustness, inaccurate localization, and a lack of fine-grained state understanding. To address these limitations, SVII-3D, a unified framework for holistic asset digitization, is proposed. First, LoRA fine-tuned open-set detection is fused with a spatial-attention matching network to robustly associate observations across sparse views. Second, a geometry-guided refinement mechanism is introduced to resolve structural errors, achieving precise decimeter-level 3D localization. Third, transcending static geometric mapping, a Vision-Language Model agent leveraging multi-modal prompting is incorporated to automatically diagnose fine-grained operational states. Experiments demonstrate that SVII-3D significantly improves identification accuracy and minimizes localization errors. Consequently, this framework offers a scalable, cost-effective solution for high-fidelity infrastructure digitization, effectively bridging the gap between sparse perception and automated intelligent maintenance.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 SVII-3D 的统一框架，用于通过融合稀疏图像数据实现资产的高精度数字化，以解决传统方法在成本效益、鲁棒性、定位精度和状态理解方面的不足，从而支持智慧城市建设和设施生命周期管理。
AI.motivation: 利用成本效益高的稀疏图像进行数字孪生和资产清单的自动化创建面临鲁棒性不足、定位不准和状态理解不精细等挑战。现有方法难以在这些约束下实现精确的资产数字化。
AI.method: SVII-3D 框架包含三个关键组成部分：1. 结合 LoRA 微调的开放集检测和空间注意力匹配网络，用于稀疏视图间的鲁棒观测关联。2. 引入几何引导的精炼机制，解决结构误差，实现分米级精度的三维定位。3. 集成利用多模态提示的视觉-语言模型代理，超越静态几何映射，自动诊断精细的操作状态。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，SVII-3D 显著提高了识别精度，并最小化了定位误差。
AI.conclusion: SVII-3D 提供了一个可扩展、成本效益高的解决方案，可实现高保真基础设施数字化，有效弥合了稀疏感知与自动化智能维护之间的差距。

title: From Single to Multi-Agent Reasoning: Advancing GeneGPT for Genomics QA
comment: Accepted paper by the 48th European Conference on Information Retrieval (ECIR'26)
summary: Comprehending genomic information is essential for biomedical research, yet extracting data from complex distributed databases remains challenging. Large language models (LLMs) offer potential for genomic Question Answering (QA) but face limitations due to restricted access to domain-specific databases. GeneGPT is the current state-of-the-art system that enhances LLMs by utilizing specialized API calls, though it is constrained by rigid API dependencies and limited adaptability. We replicate GeneGPT and propose GenomAgent, a multi-agent framework that efficiently coordinates specialized agents for complex genomics queries. Evaluated on nine tasks from the GeneTuring benchmark, GenomAgent outperforms GeneGPT by 12% on average, and its flexible architecture extends beyond genomics to various scientific domains needing expert knowledge extraction.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为GenomAgent的多智能体框架，用于从分布式基因组数据库中提取信息，相比现有的GeneGPT系统，该框架在基因组问答任务上表现更优，且具有更好的灵活性和可扩展性。
AI.motivation: 理解基因组信息对于生物医学研究至关重要，但从复杂的分布式数据库中提取数据仍具挑战性。现有的LLM方法受限于领域数据库的访问，而GeneGPT虽然通过API调用增强了LLM，但存在API依赖僵化和适应性差的问题。
AI.method: 提出GenomAgent，一个多智能体框架，通过协调专门的智能体来处理复杂的基因组查询。该框架在GeneTuring基准测试的九项任务上进行了评估。
AI.result: GenomAgent在GeneTuring基准测试的九项任务上的平均表现比GeneGPT高出12%。
AI.conclusion: GenomAgent是一个高效且灵活的多智能体框架，能够克服现有方法的局限性，并在基因组信息提取方面表现出色。其灵活的架构也使其能够应用于其他需要专业知识提取的科学领域。

title: GeoSteer: Faithful Chain-of-Thought Steering via Latent Manifold Gradients
comment: The Third workshop of NeusymBridge @AAAI 2026 (Bridging Neurons and Symbols for NLP and Knowledge Graph Reasoning)
summary: Recent advances in Large Language Models (LLMs) have improved multi-step reasoning. Most approaches rely on Chain-of-Thought (CoT) rationales. Previous studies have shown that LLMs often generate logically inconsistent reasoning steps even when their final answers are correct. These inconsistencies reduce the reliability of step-level reasoning. We propose GeoSteer, a manifold-based framework that improves the quality of intermediate reasoning. The method consists of: (1) constructing a CoT dataset with segment-level scores, (2) training a Variational Autoencoder (VAE) model and a quality estimation model to learn a low-dimensional manifold of high-quality CoT trajectories, and (3) steering hidden states of target LLMs toward higher-quality regions in the latent space. This update in a latent space behaves like a natural-gradient adjustment in the original hidden-state space. It ensures geometrically coherent steering. We evaluate GeoSteer on the GSM8k dataset using the Qwen3 series. We measure via answer accuracy and overall reasoning performance. GeoSteer improved the exact match accuracy by up to 2.6 points. It also enhanced the pairwise win rate by 5.3 points. These results indicate that GeoSteer provides an effective and controllable mechanism for improving the quality of intermediate reasoning in LLMs.

AI.tldr: GeoSteer 是一个基于流形的方法，通过学习高质量的推理轨迹的低维流形，并引导大型语言模型的隐藏状态向高质区域调整，来提升中间推理的质量。
AI.motivation: 大型语言模型在多步推理方面有所进步，但即使最终答案正确，也常生成逻辑不一致的中间推理步骤，这降低了推理的可靠性。
AI.method: 1. 构建包含片段级分数的链式思考（CoT）数据集；2. 训练变分自编码器（VAE）和质量评估模型，学习高质量CoT轨迹的低维流形；3. 将目标LLM的隐藏状态引导至潜在空间的高质量区域，这种更新类似于自然梯度调整，确保了几何上的一致性。
AI.result: 在GSM8k数据集上使用Qwen3系列模型进行评估，GeoSteer将精确匹配准确率提高了高达2.6个百分点，并将成对胜率提高了5.3个百分点。
AI.conclusion: GeoSteer 提供了一种有效且可控的机制，能够提升大型语言模型中间推理的质量。

title: Enhancing the quality of gauge images captured in smoke and haze scenes through deep learning
comment: 17 pages, 10 figures, 6 tables, SPIE Applications of Machine Learning 2023, San Diego, US
summary: Images captured in hazy and smoky environments suffer from reduced visibility, posing a challenge when monitoring infrastructures and hindering emergency services during critical situations. The proposed work investigates the use of the deep learning models to enhance the automatic, machine-based readability of gauge in smoky environments, with accurate gauge data interpretation serving as a valuable tool for first responders. The study utilizes two deep learning architectures, FFA-Net and AECR-Net, to improve the visibility of gauge images, corrupted with light up to dense haze and smoke. Since benchmark datasets of analog gauge images are unavailable, a new synthetic dataset, containing over 14,000 images, was generated using the Unreal Engine. The models were trained with an 80\% train, 10\% validation, and 10\% test split for the haze and smoke dataset, respectively. For the synthetic haze dataset, the SSIM and PSNR metrics are about 0.98 and 43\,dB, respectively, comparing well to state-of-the art results. Additionally, more robust results are retrieved from the AECR-Net, when compared to the FFA-Net. Although the results from the synthetic smoke dataset are poorer, the trained models achieve interesting results. In general, imaging in the presence of smoke are more difficult to enhance given the inhomogeneity and high density. Secondly, FFA-Net and AECR-Net are implemented to dehaze and not to desmoke images. This work shows that use of deep learning architectures can improve the quality of analog gauge images captured in smoke and haze scenes immensely. Finally, the enhanced output images can be successfully post-processed for automatic autonomous reading of gauges

AI.tldr: 该研究利用深度学习模型（FFA-Net 和 AECR-Net）来增强烟雾和雾霾环境下模拟仪表图像的可读性，并生成了一个包含 14,000 多张图像的合成数据集。结果表明，模型在雾霾数据集上表现优异，AECR-Net 优于 FFA-Net，并且增强后的图像可用于自动仪表读数。
AI.motivation: 烟雾和雾霾环境会降低能见度，影响基础设施监控和应急响应，因此需要自动化的方法来提高仪表图像的可读性，为急救人员提供有价值的数据。
AI.method: 使用 Unreal Engine 生成了一个包含 14,000 多张图像的合成数据集。训练了两种深度学习架构：FFA-Net 和 AECR-Net，并采用了 80% 训练、10% 验证、10% 测试的数据集划分。使用 SSIM 和 PSNR 指标评估模型性能。
AI.result: 在合成雾霾数据集上，SSIM 约为 0.98，PSNR 约为 43 dB，结果可与现有技术相媲美。AECR-Net 的性能优于 FFA-Net。尽管合成烟雾数据集的结果稍差，但模型仍取得了有意义的结果。烟雾的增强比雾霾更具挑战性，因为烟雾不均匀且密度高。此外，FFA-Net 和 AECR-Net 主要用于去雾，而非去烟。
AI.conclusion: 深度学习架构可以极大地提高在烟雾和雾霾场景下捕获的模拟仪表图像的质量。增强后的输出图像可以成功地进行后处理，实现仪表的自动自主读取。

title: Multi-Property Synthesis
summary: We study LTLf synthesis with multiple properties, where satisfying all properties may be impossible. Instead of enumerating subsets of properties, we compute in one fixed-point computation the relation between product-game states and the goal sets that are realizable from them, and we synthesize strategies achieving maximal realizable sets. We develop a fully symbolic algorithm that introduces Boolean goal variables and exploits monotonicity to represent exponentially many goal combinations compactly. Our approach substantially outperforms enumeration-based baselines, with speedups of up to two orders of magnitude.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种新的LTLf（Linear Temporal Logic over finite traces）多属性综合方法，能够处理属性集不可解的情况，并能合成达到最大可实现目标集合的策略。该方法通过引入布尔目标变量和利用单调性，在一个固定点计算中高效地处理了指数级增长的目标组合。
AI.motivation: 在LTLf综合任务中，当需要同时满足多个属性时，可能出现所有属性都无法同时满足的情况。现有的方法通常枚举属性子集，效率低下。本文旨在克服这一挑战，提出一种更有效率的方法来处理多属性LTLf综合，并实现最优的策略。
AI.method: 本文采用了一种全符号化的算法。该算法引入了布尔目标变量来表示目标集合，并利用单调性来紧凑地表示指数级增长的目标组合。通过一个固定点计算，直接计算产品博弈状态与可实现目标集合之间的关系，从而合成能够达到最大可实现目标集合的策略。
AI.result: 该方法在性能上显著优于基于枚举的基线方法，速度提升高达两个数量级。这表明其在处理多属性LTLf综合问题上具有很高的效率。
AI.conclusion: 本文提出了一种高效且可扩展的LTLf多属性综合算法，能够处理属性不可解的情况，并合成达到最大可实现目标集合的策略。该算法通过符号化表示和单调性利用，克服了传统枚举方法的局限性，在实践中展现出优越的性能。

title: Unleashing the Capabilities of Large Vision-Language Models for Intelligent Perception of Roadside Infrastructure
summary: Automated perception of urban roadside infrastructure is crucial for smart city management, yet general-purpose models often struggle to capture the necessary fine-grained attributes and domain rules. While Large Vision Language Models (VLMs) excel at open-world recognition, they often struggle to accurately interpret complex facility states in compliance with engineering standards, leading to unreliable performance in real-world applications. To address this, we propose a domain-adapted framework that transforms VLMs into specialized agents for intelligent infrastructure analysis. Our approach integrates a data-efficient fine-tuning strategy with a knowledge-grounded reasoning mechanism. Specifically, we leverage open-vocabulary fine-tuning on Grounding DINO to robustly localize diverse assets with minimal supervision, followed by LoRA-based adaptation on Qwen-VL for deep semantic attribute reasoning. To mitigate hallucinations and enforce professional compliance, we introduce a dual-modality Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) module that dynamically retrieves authoritative industry standards and visual exemplars during inference. Evaluated on a comprehensive new dataset of urban roadside scenes, our framework achieves a detection performance of 58.9 mAP and an attribute recognition accuracy of 95.5%, demonstrating a robust solution for intelligent infrastructure monitoring.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种领域自适应框架，通过数据高效的微调和知识增强的推理，将大型视觉语言模型（VLM）转化为智能基础设施分析的专业代理，并在城市道路场景数据集上取得了显著的检测和属性识别性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有的通用模型在理解城市道路基础设施的精细属性和领域规则方面存在困难，而大型视觉语言模型（VLM）在遵守工程标准方面表现不佳，导致在实际应用中性能不可靠。
AI.method: 该框架整合了数据高效的微调策略和知识增强的推理机制。具体来说，使用Grounding DINO进行开放词汇微调以进行目标定位，然后使用LoRA适配Qwen-VL进行语义属性推理。引入了一个双模态检索增强生成（RAG）模块，在推理时动态检索行业标准和视觉示例，以减少幻觉并确保合规性。
AI.result: 在新的城市道路场景数据集上，该框架实现了58.9 mAP的检测性能和95.5%的属性识别准确率。
AI.conclusion: 该领域自适应框架能够有效地将通用VLM转化为专门用于智能基础设施分析的专业代理，解决了现有方法的局限性，并在城市道路基础设施监控方面展现出强大的性能。

title: Loop as a Bridge: Can Looped Transformers Truly Link Representation Space and Natural Language Outputs?
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) often exhibit a gap between their internal knowledge and their explicit linguistic outputs. In this report, we empirically investigate whether Looped Transformers (LTs)--architectures that increase computational depth by iterating shared layers--can bridge this gap by utilizing their iterative nature as a form of introspection. Our experiments reveal that while increasing loop iterations narrows the gap, it is partly driven by a degradation of their internal knowledge carried by representations. Moreover, another empirical analysis suggests that current LTs' ability to perceive representations does not improve across loops; it is only present in the final loop. These results suggest that while LTs offer a promising direction for scaling computational depth, they have yet to achieve the introspection required to truly link representation space and natural language.

AI.tldr: 本文研究了循环 Transformer (LT) 架构通过迭代共享层来弥合大型语言模型 (LLMs) 内部知识与其显式语言输出之间差距的能力。实验表明，增加循环迭代次数可以缩小差距，但部分原因是其内部知识的退化。此外，LTs 感知表示的能力仅存在于最后一轮迭代中。
AI.motivation: 研究大型语言模型 (LLMs) 在内部知识和显式语言输出之间存在的差距，以及循环 Transformer (LTs) 架构的迭代特性是否能够通过内省来弥合这一差距。
AI.method: 通过实验研究增加循环迭代次数对缩小 LLMs 内部知识与显式语言输出差距的影响，并分析 LT 架构在不同循环迭代中感知表示的能力。
AI.result: 增加循环迭代次数可以缩小差距，但部分原因是其内部知识的退化。LTs 感知表示的能力仅存在于最终的循环迭代中，而非跨越所有循环。
AI.conclusion: 循环 Transformer (LTs) 架构虽然有潜力扩展计算深度，但尚未实现将表示空间与自然语言真正联系起来所需的内省能力。

title: Generative AI collective behavior needs an interactionist paradigm
summary: In this article, we argue that understanding the collective behavior of agents based on large language models (LLMs) is an essential area of inquiry, with important implications in terms of risks and benefits, impacting us as a society at many levels. We claim that the distinctive nature of LLMs--namely, their initialization with extensive pre-trained knowledge and implicit social priors, together with their capability of adaptation through in-context learning--motivates the need for an interactionist paradigm consisting of alternative theoretical foundations, methodologies, and analytical tools, in order to systematically examine how prior knowledge and embedded values interact with social context to shape emergent phenomena in multi-agent generative AI systems. We propose and discuss four directions that we consider crucial for the development and deployment of LLM-based collectives, focusing on theory, methods, and trans-disciplinary dialogue.

AI.tldr: 研究大型语言模型（LLMs）驱动的群体行为对于理解其潜在风险和收益至关重要，并提出了一种新的交互主义研究范式。
AI.motivation: LLMs具有预训练知识、社会先验和上下文学习能力，这使得理解其集体行为成为一个重要课题，尤其是在社会风险和收益方面。
AI.method: 提出并讨论了四种关键的研究方向，涵盖了理论、方法和跨学科对话，以系统地研究LLM驱动的集体中的先验知识、嵌入价值观和社会背景如何相互作用。
AI.result: 该文章强调了采用交互主义范式的重要性，该范式包括替代性的理论基础、方法论和分析工具，以应对LLM驱动的集体行为。
AI.conclusion: 需要一种新的研究范式来系统地探索LLM的集体行为，关注理论、方法和跨学科的合作，以应对其带来的社会影响。

title: One Instruction Does Not Fit All: How Well Do Embeddings Align Personas and Instructions in Low-Resource Indian Languages?
summary: Aligning multilingual assistants with culturally grounded user preferences is essential for serving India's linguistically diverse population of over one billion speakers across multiple scripts. However, existing benchmarks either focus on a single language or conflate retrieval with generation, leaving open the question of whether current embedding models can encode persona-instruction compatibility without relying on response synthesis. We present a unified benchmark spanning 12 Indian languages and four evaluation tasks: monolingual and cross-lingual persona-to-instruction retrieval, reverse retrieval from instruction to persona, and binary compatibility classification. Eight multilingual embedding models are evaluated in a frozen-encoder setting with a thin logistic regression head for classification. E5-Large-Instruct achieves the highest Recall@1 of 27.4\% on monolingual retrieval and 20.7\% on cross-lingual transfer, while BGE-M3 leads reverse retrieval at 32.1\% Recall@1. For classification, LaBSE attains 75.3\% AUROC with strong calibration. These findings offer practical guidance for model selection in Indic multilingual retrieval and establish reproducible baselines for future work\footnote{Code, datasets, and models are publicly available at https://github.com/aryashah2k/PI-Indic-Align.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一个包含12种印度语言的多语言助手对齐基准，评估了八种多语言嵌入模型在角色-指令兼容性编码方面的能力，并提供了模型选择的实用指导。
AI.motivation: 为了服务印度庞大且语言多样化的人口，需要将多语言助手与用户基于文化的偏好对齐。现有的基准存在局限性（如仅关注单一语言或混淆检索与生成），因此需要评估嵌入模型在不依赖响应生成的情况下编码角色-指令兼容性的能力。
AI.method: 研究提出了一个包含12种印度语言的统一基准，涵盖了四个评估任务：单语和跨语的角色到指令检索、指令到角色的反向检索以及二元兼容性分类。采用冻结编码器设置，并在其之上添加一个简单的逻辑回归头进行分类，对八种多语言嵌入模型进行了评估。
AI.result: E5-Large-Instruct 在单语检索任务上达到了最高的27.4% Recall@1，在跨语迁移任务上达到了20.7% Recall@1。BGE-M3 在反向检索任务上以32.1% Recall@1 领先。在分类任务中，LaBSE 取得了75.3% 的 AUROC，并表现出良好的校准性。
AI.conclusion: 研究结果为在印度语种的跨语言检索中选择模型提供了实用指导，并为未来的相关工作建立了可复现的基线。评估表明，尽管存在挑战，多语言嵌入模型在编码角色-指令兼容性方面具有潜力。

title: Inference-time Physics Alignment of Video Generative Models with Latent World Models
summary: State-of-the-art video generative models produce promising visual content yet often violate basic physics principles, limiting their utility. While some attribute this deficiency to insufficient physics understanding from pre-training, we find that the shortfall in physics plausibility also stems from suboptimal inference strategies. We therefore introduce WMReward and treat improving physics plausibility of video generation as an inference-time alignment problem. In particular, we leverage the strong physics prior of a latent world model (here, VJEPA-2) as a reward to search and steer multiple candidate denoising trajectories, enabling scaling test-time compute for better generation performance. Empirically, our approach substantially improves physics plausibility across image-conditioned, multiframe-conditioned, and text-conditioned generation settings, with validation from human preference study. Notably, in the ICCV 2025 Perception Test PhysicsIQ Challenge, we achieve a final score of 62.64%, winning first place and outperforming the previous state of the art by 7.42%. Our work demonstrates the viability of using latent world models to improve physics plausibility of video generation, beyond this specific instantiation or parameterization.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了一种名为WMReward的方法，通过在推理时利用潜在世界模型的物理先验作为奖励信号，来引导视频生成过程，从而提高生成视频的物理合理性。实验证明该方法在多种条件下的视频生成任务上均有效，并在ICCV 2025 Perception Test PhysicsIQ Challenge中取得了第一名。
AI.motivation: 现有的视频生成模型虽然在视觉内容上表现出色，但经常违反基本的物理定律，这限制了它们的实际应用。研究人员发现，这种物理合理性不足不仅源于预训练时的物理理解不足，也与次优的推理策略有关。
AI.method: 该研究将提高视频生成的物理合理性视为一个推理时间对齐问题。他们利用潜在世界模型（VJEPA-2）强大的物理先验作为奖励，来搜索和引导多个候选的去噪轨迹，从而允许在测试时扩展计算量以获得更好的生成性能。
AI.result: WMReward方法在图像条件、多帧条件和文本条件视频生成设置下都显著提高了物理合理性，并得到了人类偏好研究的验证。在ICCV 2025 Perception Test PhysicsIQ Challenge中，该方法取得了62.64%的最终得分，位居第一，并比之前的最佳表现提高了7.42%。
AI.conclusion: 研究证明了使用潜在世界模型来提高视频生成物理合理性的可行性，这种方法不局限于特定的模型实例或参数化。

title: coTherapist: A Behavior-Aligned Small Language Model to Support Mental Healthcare Experts
summary: Access to mental healthcare is increasingly strained by workforce shortages and rising demand, motivating the development of intelligent systems that can support mental healthcare experts. We introduce coTherapist, a unified framework utilizing a small language model to emulate core therapeutic competencies through domain-specific fine-tuning, retrieval augmentation, and agentic reasoning. Evaluation on clinical queries demonstrates that coTherapist generates more relevant and clinically grounded responses than contemporary baselines. Using our novel T-BARS rubric and psychometric profiling, we confirm coTherapist exhibits high empathy and therapist-consistent personality traits. Furthermore, human evaluation by domain experts validates that coTherapist delivers accurate, trustworthy, and safe responses. coTherapist was deployed and tested by clinical experts. Collectively, these findings demonstrate that small models can be engineered to exhibit expert-like behavior, offering a scalable pathway for digital mental health tools.

AI.tldr: 研究提出了一种名为 coTherapist 的框架，使用小型语言模型通过领域特定微调、检索增强和智能体推理来模拟核心治疗能力，并在临床查询中表现出比现有模型更相关、临床依据更充分的响应。
AI.motivation: 由于劳动力短缺和需求上升导致心理健康服务的获取日益困难，因此需要开发能够支持心理健康专家的智能系统。
AI.method: 该框架利用了一个小型语言模型，通过领域特定微调、检索增强和智能体推理来模拟核心治疗能力。评估使用了新的 T-BARS 评分标准和心理测量画像，并由领域专家进行了人工评估。
AI.result: coTherapist 在临床查询中生成的响应比当代基线模型更相关、临床依据更充分。该模型表现出高度的同理心和与治疗师一致的人格特征，并且由领域专家验证其响应的准确性、可信度和安全性。
AI.conclusion: 小型语言模型可以被设计成表现出专家级的行为，为数字心理健康工具提供了一条可扩展的途径。coTherapist 的开发和测试表明，这种方法在提供准确、可信赖和安全的心理健康支持方面具有潜力。

title: DeepUrban: Interaction-Aware Trajectory Prediction and Planning for Automated Driving by Aerial Imagery
summary: The efficacy of autonomous driving systems hinges critically on robust prediction and planning capabilities. However, current benchmarks are impeded by a notable scarcity of scenarios featuring dense traffic, which is essential for understanding and modeling complex interactions among road users. To address this gap, we collaborated with our industrial partner, DeepScenario, to develop DeepUrban-a new drone dataset designed to enhance trajectory prediction and planning benchmarks focusing on dense urban settings. DeepUrban provides a rich collection of 3D traffic objects, extracted from high-resolution images captured over urban intersections at approximately 100 meters altitude. The dataset is further enriched with comprehensive map and scene information to support advanced modeling and simulation tasks. We evaluate state-of-the-art (SOTA) prediction and planning methods, and conducted experiments on generalization capabilities. Our findings demonstrate that adding DeepUrban to nuScenes can boost the accuracy of vehicle predictions and planning, achieving improvements up to 44.1 % / 44.3% on the ADE / FDE metrics. Website: https://iv.ee.hm.edu/deepurban

AI.tldr: 本文介绍了一个名为DeepUrban的新无人机数据集，用于改善自动驾驶系统的轨迹预测和规划能力，特别是在拥挤的城市交通环境中。该数据集包含丰富的3D交通对象、地图和场景信息，并在nuScenes数据集的基础上进行扩展，实验表明其能显著提升预测和规划的准确性。
AI.motivation: 当前自动驾驶系统的基准测试在包含密集交通场景方面存在不足，而这些场景对于理解和模拟复杂的道路使用者交互至关重要。因此，研究人员开发了DeepUrban数据集来填补这一空白。
AI.method: 研究人员与工业合作伙伴DeepScenario合作，利用高分辨率无人机图像，在城市交叉路口捕获了大量的3D交通对象，并结合了地图和场景信息，构建了DeepUrban数据集。他们使用该数据集对最先进的预测和规划方法进行了评估，并测试了其泛化能力。
AI.result: 将DeepUrban数据集添加到nuScenes数据集中，可以显著提高车辆轨迹预测和规划的准确性，在ADE和FDE指标上分别取得了最高44.1%和44.3%的提升。
AI.conclusion: DeepUrban数据集能够有效增强自动驾驶系统的轨迹预测和规划能力，特别是在密集的城市交通场景下，为相关研究和开发提供了宝贵的资源。

title: Structure and Diversity Aware Context Bubble Construction for Enterprise Retrieval Augmented Systems
summary: Large language model (LLM) contexts are typically constructed using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG), which involves ranking and selecting the top-k passages. The approach causes fragmentation in information graphs in document structures, over-retrieval, and duplication of content alongside insufficient query context, including 2nd and 3rd order facets. In this paper, a structure-informed and diversity-constrained context bubble construction framework is proposed that assembles coherent, citable bundles of spans under a strict token budget. The method preserves and exploits inherent document structure by organising multi-granular spans (e.g., sections and rows) and using task-conditioned structural priors to guide retrieval. Starting from high-relevance anchor spans, a context bubble is constructed through constrained selection that balances query relevance, marginal coverage, and redundancy penalties. It will explicitly constrain diversity and budget, producing compact and informative context sets, unlike top-k retrieval. Moreover, a full retrieval is emitted that traces the scoring and selection choices of the records, thus providing auditability and deterministic tuning. Experiments on enterprise documents demonstrate the efficiency of context bubble as it significantly reduces redundant context, is better able to cover secondary facets and has a better answer quality and citation faithfulness within a limited context window. Ablation studies demonstrate that both structural priors as well as diversity constraint selection are necessary; removing either component results in a decline in coverage and an increase in redundant or incomplete context.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种结构感知的、多样性约束的上下文气泡构建框架，用于在LLM的RAG中生成更紧凑、信息更丰富、可引用且冗余度低的上下文，优于传统的Top-k检索方法。
AI.motivation: 传统的RAG方法在构建LLM上下文时存在信息图碎片化、过度检索、内容重复以及查询上下文不足（包括高阶方面）等问题。
AI.method: 提出了一种结构感知的、多样性约束的上下文气泡构建框架。该框架利用文档结构（如章节、行）组织多粒度跨度，并使用任务条件结构先验指导检索。从高相关性锚点跨度开始，通过约束选择来构建上下文气泡，平衡查询相关性、边际覆盖率和冗余惩罚，同时明确约束多样性和令牌预算。此外，还提供了一个完整的检索日志，用于审计和调优。
AI.result: 在企业文档上的实验表明，上下文气泡显著减少了冗余上下文，更好地覆盖了次要方面，并在有限的上下文窗口内提高了答案质量和引用忠实度。消融研究证明了结构先验和多样性约束选择的必要性。
AI.conclusion: 所提出的上下文气泡构建框架能够生成紧凑、信息丰富且可引用的上下文集，有效解决了传统RAG方法中的信息碎片化、重复和上下文不足问题，在实际应用中表现出更高的效率和质量。

title: Panning for Gold: Expanding Domain-Specific Knowledge Graphs with General Knowledge
summary: Domain-specific knowledge graphs (DKGs) often lack coverage compared to general knowledge graphs (GKGs). To address this, we introduce Domain-specific Knowledge Graph Fusion (DKGF), a novel task that enriches DKGs by integrating relevant facts from GKGs. DKGF faces two key challenges: high ambiguity in domain relevance and misalignment in knowledge granularity across graphs. We propose ExeFuse, a simple yet effective Fact-as-Program paradigm. It treats each GKG fact as a latent semantic program, maps abstract relations to granularity-aware operators, and verifies domain relevance via program executability on the target DKG. This unified probabilistic framework jointly resolves relevance and granularity issues. We construct two benchmarks, DKGF(W-I) and DKGF(Y-I), with 21 evaluation configurations. Extensive experiments validate the task's importance and our model's effectiveness, providing the first standardized testbed for DKGF.

AI.tldr: 该研究提出了一种名为DKGF（领域知识图谱融合）的新任务，旨在通过整合通用知识图谱（GKG）中的相关事实来丰富覆盖度不足的领域知识图谱（DKG）。他们还提出了一种名为ExeFuse的模型，该模型将GKG的事实视为潜在的语义程序，通过程序的可执行性来解决领域相关性和知识粒度不匹配的问题。
AI.motivation: 领域特定的知识图谱（DKGs）往往覆盖度不足，而通用的知识图谱（GKGs）虽然覆盖广但可能缺乏领域深度。如何有效地将GKGs中的知识迁移到DKGs中，以弥补其覆盖度不足是研究的动机。
AI.method: 提出了一种名为ExeFuse的“事实即程序”（Fact-as-Program）的范式。该范式将GKG中的每个事实视为一个潜在的语义程序，将抽象的关系映射到粒度感知的算子，并通过在目标DKG上执行程序来验证领域相关性。这是一个统一的概率框架，联合解决了相关性和粒度问题。
AI.result: 提出的ExeFuse模型能够有效地解决DKGF任务中的领域相关性和知识粒度不匹配的问题。通过在两个新构建的基准测试集DKGF(W-I)和DKGF(Y-I)上进行的大量实验，验证了该任务的重要性和模型的有效性。
AI.conclusion: 该研究定义并解决了DKGF这一新的知识图谱融合任务，并提出了一种有效的模型ExeFuse。ExeFuse通过将GKG事实表示为程序，并利用程序的执行来解决领域相关性和粒度问题，为DKGF领域提供了一个标准化的测试平台。

title: The Impact of Generative AI on Architectural Conceptual Design: Performance, Creative Self-Efficacy and Cognitive Load
summary: Our study examines how generative AI (GenAI) influences performance, creative self-efficacy, and cognitive load in architectural conceptual design tasks. Thirty-six student participants from Architectural Engineering and other disciplines completed a two-phase architectural design task, first independently and then with external tools (GenAI-assisted condition and control condition using an online repository of existing architectural projects). Design outcomes were evaluated by expert raters, while self-efficacy and cognitive load were self-reported after each phase. Difference-in-differences analyses revealed no overall performance advantage of GenAI across participants; however, subgroup analyses showed that GenAI significantly improved design performance for novice designers. In contrast, general creative self-efficacy declined for students using GenAI. Cognitive load did not differ significantly between conditions, though prompt usage patterns showed that iterative idea generation and visual feedback prompts were linked to greater reductions in cognitive load. These findings suggest that GenAI effectiveness depends on users' prior expertise and interaction strategies through prompting.

AI.tldr: 生成式AI（GenAI）在建筑概念设计中，对新手设计师有益，但可能降低整体创造力自我效能感。其效果取决于用户的专业知识和提示策略。
AI.motivation: 探究生成式AI（GenAI）在建筑概念设计中对绩效、创造力自我效能感和认知负荷的影响。
AI.method: 招募36名学生，在两阶段建筑设计任务中，分别独立完成和使用外部工具（GenAI辅助或对照组的在线项目库）。通过专家评分评估设计成果，并进行自我报告的效能感和认知负荷测量。采用双重差分分析。
AI.result: GenAI在整体绩效上无显著优势。但在子群体分析中，GenAI显著提升了新手设计师的设计绩效。使用GenAI的学生，其创造力自我效能感下降。认知负荷在两组间无显著差异，但迭代式创意生成和视觉反馈提示与认知负荷降低相关。
AI.conclusion: GenAI在建筑概念设计中的有效性取决于用户的先验专业知识和通过提示进行的交互策略。GenAI对新手设计师有益，但可能影响其创造力自我效能感。

title: Untangling Input Language from Reasoning Language: A Diagnostic Framework for Cross-Lingual Moral Alignment in LLMs
summary: When LLMs judge moral dilemmas, do they reach different conclusions in different languages, and if so, why? Two factors could drive such differences: the language of the dilemma itself, or the language in which the model reasons. Standard evaluation conflates these by testing only matched conditions (e.g., English dilemma with English reasoning). We introduce a methodology that separately manipulates each factor, covering also mismatched conditions (e.g., English dilemma with Chinese reasoning), enabling decomposition of their contributions. To study \emph{what} changes, we propose an approach to interpret the moral judgments in terms of Moral Foundations Theory. As a side result, we identify evidence for splitting the Authority dimension into a family-related and an institutional dimension. Applying this methodology to English-Chinese moral judgment with 13 LLMs, we demonstrate its diagnostic power: (1) the framework isolates reasoning-language effects as contributing twice the variance of input-language effects; (2) it detects context-dependency in nearly half of models that standard evaluation misses; and (3) a diagnostic taxonomy translates these patterns into deployment guidance. We release our code and datasets at https://anonymous.4open.science/r/CrossCulturalMoralJudgement.

AI.tldr: 本研究开发了一种新的评估方法，用于解耦语言（问题语言和推理语言）对大型语言模型（LLMs）道德判断的影响，并利用道德基础理论来解释模型决策，发现推理语言的影响力是问题语言的两倍，并为LLMs在跨文化场景下的部署提供了指导。
AI.motivation: 现有的大型语言模型（LLMs）在进行道德判断时，在不同语言下是否会得出不同结论，以及其原因尚不清楚。现有的评估方法将问题语言和推理语言混淆，无法区分两者的独立贡献。
AI.method: 提出了一种新的评估方法，该方法能够独立操纵问题语言和推理语言，并引入了基于道德基础理论（Moral Foundations Theory）的解释方法来分析模型判断的内在因素。研究了英语-中文的道德判断，并对13个LLMs进行了测试。
AI.result: 发现推理语言对LLMs道德判断的影响是问题语言的两倍。近一半的模型在标准评估方法下未检测到的情境依赖性，在该方法下被检测出来。研究还为将“权威”维度细分为“家庭相关”和“机构相关”提供了证据。
AI.conclusion: 通过将问题语言和推理语言解耦，可以更准确地诊断LLMs在跨文化道德判断中的行为模式。这种诊断方法可以指导LLMs在不同文化背景下的部署，并发现了道德基础理论在解释LLMs道德判断方面的潜力。

title: Jordan-Segmentable Masks: A Topology-Aware definition for characterizing Binary Image Segmentation
summary:
Image segmentation plays a central role in computer vision. However, widely used evaluation metrics, whether pixel-wise, region-based, or boundary-focused, often struggle to capture the structural and topological coherence of a segmentation. In many practical scenarios, such as medical imaging or object delineation, small inaccuracies in boundary, holes, or fragmented predictions can result in high metric scores, despite the fact that the resulting masks fail to preserve the object global shape or connectivity. This highlights a limitation of conventional metrics: they are unable to assess whether a predicted segmentation partitions the image into meaningful interior and exterior regions.
  In this work, we introduce a topology-aware notion of segmentation based on the Jordan Curve Theorem, and adapted for use in digital planes. We define the concept of a \emph{Jordan-segmentatable mask}, which is a binary segmentation whose structure ensures a topological separation of the image domain into two connected components. We analyze segmentation masks through the lens of digital topology and homology theory, extracting a $4$-curve candidate from the mask, verifying its topological validity using Betti numbers. A mask is considered Jordan-segmentatable when this candidate forms a digital 4-curve with $β_0 = β_1 = 1$, or equivalently when its complement splits into exactly two $8$-connected components.
  This framework provides a mathematically rigorous, unsupervised criterion with which to assess the structural coherence of segmentation masks. By combining digital Jordan theory and homological invariants, our approach provides a valuable alternative to standard evaluation metrics, especially in applications where topological correctness must be preserved.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种基于 Jordan 曲线定理的拓扑感知图像分割评估方法，称为 Jordan-segmentatable mask，用于评估分割结果的结构和拓扑一致性。
AI.motivation: 现有的分割评估指标（像素级、区域级、边界级）在评估分割结果的结构和拓扑连贯性方面存在不足，即使存在细微的边界错误、孔洞或碎片化，也可能获得高分，但分割结果却无法保持全局形状或连通性。这表明现有指标无法评估分割是否将图像划分为有意义的内部和外部区域。
AI.method: 该研究基于 Jordan 曲线定理，并针对数字平面进行了调整，定义了“Jordan-segmentatable mask”。该方法通过数字拓扑和同调理论分析分割掩码，提取 4-曲线候选，并使用 Betti 数验证其拓扑有效性。当候选构成一个数字 4-曲线且 $β_0 = β_1 = 1$（或其补集恰好分为两个 8-连通分量）时，该掩码被认为是 Jordan-segmentatable。
AI.result: 提出了一种数学上严谨、无监督的标准来评估分割掩码的结构一致性。结合数字 Jordan 理论和同调不变量，该方法提供了一种评估分割拓扑正确性的有效途径。
AI.conclusion: 该拓扑感知评估方法为评估分割掩码的结构和拓扑一致性提供了一个有价值的替代方案，尤其适用于需要保持拓扑正确性的应用场景。

title: Measuring Affinity between Attention-Head Weight Subspaces via the Projection Kernel
summary: Understanding relationships between attention heads is essential for interpreting the internal structure of Transformers, yet existing metrics do not capture this structure well. We focus on the subspaces spanned by attention-head weight matrices and quantify head-to-head relationships using the Projection Kernel (PK), a principal-angle-based measure of subspace similarity. Experiments show that PK reproduces known head-to-head interactions on the IOI task more clearly than prior metrics such as the Composition Score. We further introduce a framework to quantify the informativeness of PK distributions by comparing them with a reference distribution derived from random orthogonal subspaces. As an application, we analyze a directed graph constructed from PK and show that, in GPT2-small, L4H7 acts as a hub by functioning as an identity head.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为投影核（PK）的度量方法，用于量化 Transformer attention 头的子空间相似性，并以此来理解头之间的关系。实验证明 PK 比现有方法更清晰地捕捉到了头之间的相互作用，并且在 GPT2-small 模型中发现 L4H7 作为一个“身份头”起着中心枢纽的作用。
AI.motivation: 现有的度量方法未能很好地捕捉 Transformer attention 头之间的结构化关系，而理解这种关系对于模型解释至关重要。
AI.method: 使用投影核（PK）来衡量注意力头权重矩阵所张成的子空间的相似性。PK 基于主角度量，并引入了一个框架来量化 PK 分布的信息量。
AI.result: PK 比现有的度量方法（如 Composition Score）更清晰地重现了 IOI 任务中已知的头-头交互。在 GPT2-small 模型中，分析 PK 构建的定向图发现 L4H7 作为一个“身份头”充当了中心枢纽。
AI.conclusion: 投影核（PK）是一种有效的度量方法，可以更好地捕捉 Transformer attention 头之间的关系，并有助于理解模型的内部结构。通过 PK 分析，可以识别出模型中的关键组件，例如 GPT2-small 中的 L4H7。

title: MoST: Mixing Speech and Text with Modality-Aware Mixture of Experts
summary: We present MoST (Mixture of Speech and Text), a novel multimodal large language model that seamlessly integrates speech and text processing through our proposed Modality-Aware Mixture of Experts (MAMoE) architecture. While current multimodal models typically process diverse modality representations with identical parameters, disregarding their inherent representational differences, we introduce specialized routing pathways that direct tokens to modality-appropriate experts based on input type. MAMoE simultaneously enhances modality-specific learning and cross-modal understanding through two complementary components: modality-specific expert groups that capture domain-specific patterns and shared experts that facilitate information transfer between modalities. Building on this architecture, we develop an efficient transformation pipeline that adapts the pretrained MoE language model through strategic post-training on ASR and TTS datasets, followed by fine-tuning with a carefully curated speech-text instruction dataset. A key feature of this pipeline is that it relies exclusively on fully accessible, open-source datasets to achieve strong performance and data efficiency. Comprehensive evaluations across ASR, TTS, audio language modeling, and spoken question answering benchmarks show that MoST consistently outperforms existing models of comparable parameter counts. Our ablation studies confirm that the modality-specific routing mechanism and shared experts design significantly contribute to performance gains across all tested domains. To our knowledge, MoST represents the first fully open-source speech-text LLM built on a Mixture of Experts architecture. \footnote{We release MoST model, training code, inference code, and training data at https://github.com/NUS-HPC-AI-Lab/MoST

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为 MoST 的新颖多模态大语言模型，它通过创新的 MAMoE 架构将语音和文本处理无缝集成。MoST 利用模态感知专家混合（MAMoE）来根据输入类型将 token 路由到合适的专家，实现了模态特定学习和跨模态理解。该模型通过在 ASR 和 TTS 数据集上进行策略性后训练，然后在一个精选的语音-文本指令数据集上进行微调而得到。MoST 是首个基于 MoE 架构的完全开源语音-文本 LLM，在多项语音和文本任务上表现优于同类模型。
AI.motivation: 现有的大多数多模态模型使用相同的参数处理不同模态的表示，忽略了它们固有的差异。研究者希望开发一种能够有效处理和整合语音和文本信息的多模态模型，并提高模态特定学习和跨模态理解的能力。
AI.method: 研究者提出了 Modality-Aware Mixture of Experts (MAMoE) 架构，该架构包含模态特定的专家组和共享专家。它通过专门的路由机制，根据输入类型将 token 分配给合适的专家。在此基础上，研究者设计了一个高效的转化流程，利用开源的 ASR、TTS 和语音-文本指令数据集，对预训练的 MoE 语言模型进行后训练和微调。
AI.result: MoST 在 ASR、TTS、音频语言建模和口语问答等多个基准测试中，性能 consistently 优于参数量相当的现有模型。消融研究表明，模态特定的路由机制和共享专家的设计对所有测试领域的性能提升都起到了显著作用。
AI.conclusion: MoST 是一种新颖且高效的多模态大语言模型，通过 MAMoE 架构成功地集成了语音和文本处理。该模型实现了强大的性能，并且是第一个基于 MoE 架构的完全开源语音-文本 LLM，为后续研究和应用奠定了基础。

title: The Straight and Narrow: Do LLMs Possess an Internal Moral Path?
summary: Enhancing the moral alignment of Large Language Models (LLMs) is a critical challenge in AI safety. Current alignment techniques often act as superficial guardrails, leaving the intrinsic moral representations of LLMs largely untouched. In this paper, we bridge this gap by leveraging Moral Foundations Theory (MFT) to map and manipulate the fine-grained moral landscape of LLMs. Through cross-lingual linear probing, we validate the shared nature of moral representations in middle layers and uncover a shared yet different moral subspace between English and Chinese. Building upon this, we extract steerable Moral Vectors and successfully validate their efficacy at both internal and behavioral levels. Leveraging the high generalizability of morality, we propose Adaptive Moral Fusion (AMF), a dynamic inference-time intervention that synergizes probe detection with vector injection to tackle the safety-helpfulness trade-off. Empirical results confirm that our approach acts as a targeted intrinsic defense, effectively reducing incorrect refusals on benign queries while minimizing jailbreak success rates compared to standard baselines.

AI.tldr: 本研究利用道德基础理论（MFT）来映射和操纵大型语言模型（LLMs）的内在道德表征，提出了一种名为自适应道德融合（AMF）的动态干预方法，以在不牺牲安全性的前提下提高助益性，并有效减少错误拒绝和越狱成功率。
AI.motivation: 当前的LLMs对齐技术通常是表面的，未能触及LLMs内在的道德表征。研究者希望弥合这一差距，实现更深层次的道德对齐。
AI.method: 利用道德基础理论（MFT）来理解和操纵LLMs的道德表征。通过跨语言线性探测验证了道德表征的共享性，并提取了可操纵的道德向量。在此基础上，提出了自适应道德融合（AMF），一种在推理时动态干预的方法。
AI.result: 成功验证了道德向量的有效性，并证明AMF能够有效减少对良性查询的错误拒绝，同时最小化越狱成功率，优于标准基线方法。
AI.conclusion: AMF是一种有效的内在防御机制，能够动态地增强LLMs的道德对齐，解决安全与助益性的权衡问题，并能有效抵御不良行为。

title: Action100M: A Large-scale Video Action Dataset
summary: Inferring physical actions from visual observations is a fundamental capability for advancing machine intelligence in the physical world. Achieving this requires large-scale, open-vocabulary video action datasets that span broad domains. We introduce Action100M, a large-scale dataset constructed from 1.2M Internet instructional videos (14.6 years of duration), yielding O(100 million) temporally localized segments with open-vocabulary action supervision and rich captions. Action100M is generated by a fully automated pipeline that (i) performs hierarchical temporal segmentation using V-JEPA 2 embeddings, (ii) produces multi-level frame and segment captions organized as a Tree-of-Captions, and (iii) aggregates evidence with a reasoning model (GPT-OSS-120B) under a multi-round Self-Refine procedure to output structured annotations (brief/detailed action, actor, brief/detailed caption). Training VL-JEPA on Action100M demonstrates consistent data-scaling improvements and strong zero-shot performance across diverse action recognition benchmarks, establishing Action100M as a new foundation for scalable research in video understanding and world modeling.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了Action100M，一个包含1.2M个互联网教学视频（总时长14.6年）的大规模数据集，其中包含约1亿个具有开放词汇动作监督和丰富字幕的时间局部化片段，旨在推动视频动作理解和世界模型研究。
AI.motivation: 为了让机器学习能够理解物理世界中的动作，需要大规模、开放词汇的视频动作数据集，以覆盖广泛的领域。
AI.method: 使用全自动流水线生成Action100M数据集：1. 利用V-JEPA 2嵌入进行分层时间分割。2. 生成多层次的帧和片段字幕，组织成“字幕树”。3. 利用GPT-OSS-120B推理模型，通过多轮“自精炼”程序聚合证据，输出结构化标注（动作简述/详情、执行者、字幕简述/详情）。
AI.result: 在Action100M数据集上训练VL-JEPA，展示了数据规模扩展带来的性能提升，以及在各种动作识别基准上的强大零样本（zero-shot）性能。
AI.conclusion: Action100M是一个新的、可扩展的视频理解和世界模型研究基础，能够通过大规模数据训练模型并实现优异的零样本动作识别能力。

title: RSATalker: Realistic Socially-Aware Talking Head Generation for Multi-Turn Conversation
summary: Talking head generation is increasingly important in virtual reality (VR), especially for social scenarios involving multi-turn conversation. Existing approaches face notable limitations: mesh-based 3D methods can model dual-person dialogue but lack realistic textures, while large-model-based 2D methods produce natural appearances but incur prohibitive computational costs. Recently, 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) based methods achieve efficient and realistic rendering but remain speaker-only and ignore social relationships. We introduce RSATalker, the first framework that leverages 3DGS for realistic and socially-aware talking head generation with support for multi-turn conversation. Our method first drives mesh-based 3D facial motion from speech, then binds 3D Gaussians to mesh facets to render high-fidelity 2D avatar videos. To capture interpersonal dynamics, we propose a socially-aware module that encodes social relationships, including blood and non-blood as well as equal and unequal, into high-level embeddings through a learnable query mechanism. We design a three-stage training paradigm and construct the RSATalker dataset with speech-mesh-image triplets annotated with social relationships. Extensive experiments demonstrate that RSATalker achieves state-of-the-art performance in both realism and social awareness. The code and dataset will be released.

AI.tldr: RSATalker 是一个新框架，利用 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) 技术生成逼真且具有社交意识的多人对话视频。
AI.motivation: 现有方法在生成逼真的多人对话视频方面存在不足：基于网格的 3D 方法纹理不真实，基于大模型的 2D 方法计算成本高，而 3DGS 方法虽然渲染效率高且逼真，但只支持单人且忽略社交关系。
AI.method: RSATalker 首先从语音驱动基于网格的 3D 面部运动，然后将 3D 高斯点绑定到网格面上进行渲染。它还引入了一个社交意识模块，通过可学习的查询机制将社交关系（如血亲/非血亲、平等/不平等）编码成高层嵌入。训练采用三阶段范式，并构建了一个带有社交关系标注的 RSATalker 数据集。
AI.result: 实验证明 RSATalker 在真实感和社交意识方面均达到了最先进的性能。
AI.conclusion: RSATalker 是首个将 3DGS 应用于多人对话视频生成，并成功融入社交意识的框架，在真实性和社交互动方面均表现出色。

title: Multilinguality as Sense Adaptation
summary: We approach multilinguality as sense adaptation: aligning latent meaning representations across languages rather than relying solely on shared parameters and scale. In this paper, we introduce SENse-based Symmetric Interlingual Alignment (SENSIA), which adapts a Backpack language model from one language to another by explicitly aligning sense-level mixtures and contextual representations on parallel data, while jointly training a target-language language modeling loss to preserve fluency. Across benchmarks on four typologically diverse languages, SENSIA generally outperforms comparable multilingual alignment methods and achieves competitive accuracy against monolingual from-scratch baselines while using 2-4x less target-language data. Analyses of learned sense geometry indicate that local sense topology and global structure relative to English are largely preserved, and ablations show that the method is robust in terms of design and scale.

AI.tldr: 本文提出了一种名为SENSIA（SENse-based Symmetric Interlingual Alignment）的新方法，通过显式对齐不同语言的潜在语义表示来实现多语言能力，而非仅依赖共享参数。
AI.motivation: 传统的跨语言迁移方法主要依赖共享参数，而本文认为多语言能力可以通过对齐不同语言中的语义含义来获得，并在此基础上提出了SENSIA方法。
AI.method: SENSIA通过在平行语料上显式对齐源语言和目标语言的词汇混合和上下文表示，并结合目标语言的语言模型损失来提高流畅性，从而实现从一种语言到另一种语言的迁移。
AI.result: 在四种不同语族的语言上的测试表明，SENSIA的性能普遍优于其他多语言对齐方法，并且在仅使用2-4倍目标语言数据的情况下，能达到与从头开始训练的单语模型相媲美的准确率。
AI.conclusion: SENSIA能够有效地将多语言能力迁移到目标语言，并在保证语义信息完整性的同时，显著减少了对目标语言数据的需求，同时该方法在设计和规模上表现出良好的鲁棒性。

title: OctoBench: Benchmarking Scaffold-Aware Instruction Following in Repository-Grounded Agentic Coding
summary: Modern coding scaffolds turn LLMs into capable software agents, but their ability to follow scaffold-specified instructions remains under-examined, especially when constraints are heterogeneous and persist across interactions. To fill this gap, we introduce OctoBench, which benchmarks scaffold-aware instruction following in repository-grounded agentic coding. OctoBench includes 34 environments and 217 tasks instantiated under three scaffold types, and is paired with 7,098 objective checklist items. To disentangle solving the task from following the rules, we provide an automated observation-and-scoring toolkit that captures full trajectories and performs fine-grained checks. Experiments on eight representative models reveal a systematic gap between task-solving and scaffold-aware compliance, underscoring the need for training and evaluation that explicitly targets heterogeneous instruction following. We release the benchmark to support reproducible benchmarking and to accelerate the development of more scaffold-aware coding agents.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了OctoBench，一个用于评估大型语言模型（LLM）作为编码代理遵循指令的能力的基准测试。研究发现，LLM在完成任务和严格遵守指令之间存在差距，这表明需要专门针对指令遵循的训练和评估。
AI.motivation: 现有研究对LLM作为编码代理时遵循复杂、异构且持久指令的能力了解不足，作者希望填补这一研究空白。
AI.method: 作者提出了OctoBench基准测试，包含34个环境、217个任务和三种脚手架类型，并附带7098个客观的检查项。他们开发了一个自动化的观察和评分工具包，用于捕获完整的交互轨迹并进行细粒度检查，以区分解决任务和遵守规则。
AI.result: 实验结果表明，在八个代表性模型上，LLM在解决任务的能力与遵守脚手架指令的能力之间存在系统性差距，突显了在训练和评估中明确针对异构指令遵循的必要性。
AI.conclusion: LLM在作为编码代理时，其遵循复杂指令的能力仍有待提高。研究强调了开发更具“脚手架感知能力”的编码代理的重要性，并发布了OctoBench以促进可复现的基准测试和加速相关研究。

title: ADVOSYNTH: A Synthetic Multi-Advocate Dataset for Speaker Identification in Courtroom Scenarios
summary:
As large-scale speech-to-speech models achieve high fidelity, the distinction between synthetic voices in structured environments becomes a vital area of study. This paper introduces Advosynth-500, a specialized dataset comprising 100 synthetic speech files featuring 10 unique advocate identities. Using the Speech Llama Omni model, we simulate five distinct advocate pairs engaged in courtroom arguments. We define specific vocal characteristics for each advocate and present a speaker identification challenge to evaluate the ability of modern systems to map audio files to their respective synthetic origins.
  Dataset is available at this link-https: //github.com/naturenurtureelite/ADVOSYNTH-500.

AI.tldr: 本研究提出了 Advosynth-500 数据集，包含 100 个合成语音文件，由 10 个独特的模拟辩护律师身份组成，用于评估现代系统区分合成语音的能力。
AI.motivation: 随着大规模语音到语音模型生成高保真语音，在结构化环境中区分合成语音成为一个重要的研究课题。
AI.method: 使用 Speech Llama Omni 模型，模拟了五个不同的辩护律师对进行法庭辩论，并为每个辩护律师定义了特定的声音特征，构建了 Advosynth-500 数据集。提出了一个说话人识别挑战来评估系统。
AI.result: Advosynth-500 数据集包含 100 个合成语音文件，由 10 个独特的声音身份组成，模拟了五对辩护律师在法庭上的辩论。
AI.conclusion: Advosynth-500 数据集和提出的说话人识别挑战旨在评估现代系统区分不同合成语音身份的能力，尤其是在模拟法庭辩论的结构化环境中。

title: Are Your Reasoning Models Reasoning or Guessing? A Mechanistic Analysis of Hierarchical Reasoning Models
summary: Hierarchical reasoning model (HRM) achieves extraordinary performance on various reasoning tasks, significantly outperforming large language model-based reasoners. To understand the strengths and potential failure modes of HRM, we conduct a mechanistic study on its reasoning patterns and find three surprising facts: (a) Failure of extremely simple puzzles, e.g., HRM can fail on a puzzle with only one unknown cell. We attribute this failure to the violation of the fixed point property, a fundamental assumption of HRM. (b) "Grokking" dynamics in reasoning steps, i.e., the answer is not improved uniformly, but instead there is a critical reasoning step that suddenly makes the answer correct; (c) Existence of multiple fixed points. HRM "guesses" the first fixed point, which could be incorrect, and gets trapped there for a while or forever. All facts imply that HRM appears to be "guessing" instead of "reasoning". Leveraging this "guessing" picture, we propose three strategies to scale HRM's guesses: data augmentation (scaling the quality of guesses), input perturbation (scaling the number of guesses by leveraging inference randomness), and model bootstrapping (scaling the number of guesses by leveraging training randomness). On the practical side, by combining all methods, we develop Augmented HRM, boosting accuracy on Sudoku-Extreme from 54.5% to 96.9%. On the scientific side, our analysis provides new insights into how reasoning models "reason".

AI.tldr: 本研究对分层推理模型（HRM）进行了机制性研究，发现其推理过程存在“猜测”而非“推理”的现象，并提出了三种改进策略，显著提升了HRM在Sudoku-Extreme上的准确率。
AI.motivation: 为了理解HRM在推理任务上表现出色的原因及其潜在的失败模式。
AI.method: 通过机制性研究HRM的推理模式，分析其在简单谜题上的失败原因、推理步骤中的“grokking”现象以及多固定点问题。基于“猜测”的洞察，提出数据增强、输入扰动和模型自举三种策略来扩展HRM的猜测能力。
AI.result: 发现HRM在极简谜题上会失败（违反固定点性质），推理过程中存在“grokking”现象（答案突然变正确），以及存在多个固定点导致HRM可能被困在错误的猜测中。提出的三种策略组合（Augmented HRM）将Sudoku-Extreme的准确率从54.5%提升到96.9%。
AI.conclusion: HRM的成功可能归因于一种“猜测”机制，而非严格的“推理”。通过数据增强、输入扰动和模型自举等策略可以有效改进HRM的性能，并为理解推理模型的工作原理提供了新的视角。

title: Molmo2: Open Weights and Data for Vision-Language Models with Video Understanding and Grounding
summary: Today's strongest video-language models (VLMs) remain proprietary. The strongest open-weight models either rely on synthetic data from proprietary VLMs, effectively distilling from them, or do not disclose their training data or recipe. As a result, the open-source community lacks the foundations needed to improve on the state-of-the-art video (and image) language models. Crucially, many downstream applications require more than just high-level video understanding; they require grounding -- either by pointing or by tracking in pixels. Even proprietary models lack this capability. We present Molmo2, a new family of VLMs that are state-of-the-art among open-source models and demonstrate exceptional new capabilities in point-driven grounding in single image, multi-image, and video tasks. Our key contribution is a collection of 7 new video datasets and 2 multi-image datasets, including a dataset of highly detailed video captions for pre-training, a free-form video Q&A dataset for fine-tuning, a new object tracking dataset with complex queries, and an innovative new video pointing dataset, all collected without the use of closed VLMs. We also present a training recipe for this data utilizing an efficient packing and message-tree encoding scheme, and show bi-directional attention on vision tokens and a novel token-weight strategy improves performance. Our best-in-class 8B model outperforms others in the class of open weight and data models on short videos, counting, and captioning, and is competitive on long-videos. On video-grounding Molmo2 significantly outperforms existing open-weight models like Qwen3-VL (35.5 vs 29.6 accuracy on video counting) and surpasses proprietary models like Gemini 3 Pro on some tasks (38.4 vs 20.0 F1 on video pointing and 56.2 vs 41.1 J&F on video tracking).

AI.tldr: 本文提出了 Molmo2，一个新的开源视频-语言模型（VLM）系列，它在开源模型中达到了最先进水平，并在点驱动的定位任务（包括单图像、多图像和视频）中展现了卓越的新能力。该模型通过使用 7 个新的视频数据集和 2 个多图像数据集进行训练，这些数据集是在不使用闭源 VLM 的情况下收集的。
AI.motivation: 当前的顶尖视频-语言模型（VLM）大多是闭源的，而开源模型要么依赖于闭源 VLM 的合成数据，要么不公开其训练数据。这阻碍了开源社区在视频（和图像）语言模型方面的进步。此外，许多下游应用需要像素级别的定位（点选或跟踪）能力，而现有模型（包括闭源模型）在这方面存在不足。
AI.method: 本文提出了 Molmo2 模型系列，其训练使用了 7 个新的视频数据集和 2 个多图像数据集，这些数据集是在不使用闭源 VLM 的情况下收集的。具体的训练方法包括：详细的视频字幕预训练数据集、自由形式的视频问答微调数据集、带有复杂查询的新对象跟踪数据集、以及创新的视频点选数据集。此外，还采用了高效的打包和消息树编码方案，并展示了在视觉 token 上的双向注意力机制和新的 token 权重策略可以提高性能。
AI.result: Molmo2 的最佳 8B 模型在短视频、计数和字幕生成方面优于其他开源模型，并且在长视频方面具有竞争力。在视频定位任务上，Molmo2 显著优于现有的开源模型（例如，在视频计数任务上，Molmo2 的准确率为 35.5%，而 Qwen3-VL 为 29.6%），并在某些任务上超越了闭源模型（例如，在视频点选任务上，Molmo2 的 F1 分数为 38.4%，而 Gemini 3 Pro 为 20.0%；在视频跟踪任务上，Molmo2 的 J&F 分数为 56.2%，而 Gemini 3 Pro 为 41.1%）。
AI.conclusion: Molmo2 是一个强大的新一代开源视频-语言模型系列，它通过创新的数据集和训练策略，在视频理解和像素级定位任务上取得了显著的进步，为开源社区提供了重要的基础，并在多项基准测试中展现出超越现有开源模型甚至部分闭源模型的性能。

title: CoMoVi: Co-Generation of 3D Human Motions and Realistic Videos
summary: In this paper, we find that the generation of 3D human motions and 2D human videos is intrinsically coupled. 3D motions provide the structural prior for plausibility and consistency in videos, while pre-trained video models offer strong generalization capabilities for motions, which necessitate coupling their generation processes. Based on this, we present CoMoVi, a co-generative framework that couples two video diffusion models (VDMs) to generate 3D human motions and videos synchronously within a single diffusion denoising loop. To achieve this, we first propose an effective 2D human motion representation that can inherit the powerful prior of pre-trained VDMs. Then, we design a dual-branch diffusion model to couple human motion and video generation process with mutual feature interaction and 3D-2D cross attentions. Moreover, we curate CoMoVi Dataset, a large-scale real-world human video dataset with text and motion annotations, covering diverse and challenging human motions. Extensive experiments demonstrate the effectiveness of our method in both 3D human motion and video generation tasks.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种名为CoMoVi的联合生成框架，通过耦合两个视频扩散模型（VDMs），在单一的去噪循环中同步生成3D人体运动和2D人体视频，并通过新数据集进行了验证。
AI.motivation: 3D人体运动和2D人体视频的生成存在内在耦合关系：3D运动提供了视频的结构先验，而预训练的视频模型为运动提供了泛化能力，因此需要将它们的生成过程耦合起来。
AI.method: 提出了一种有效的2D人体运动表示，并设计了一个双分支扩散模型，通过特征交互和3D-2D交叉注意力机制来实现人体运动和视频生成的耦合。该方法在一个单一的去噪循环中同步进行。
AI.result: 在3D人体运动生成和2D人体视频生成任务上都取得了有效的实验结果。
AI.conclusion: CoMoVi框架成功地实现了3D人体运动和2D人体视频的同步生成，证明了联合生成方法的有效性。

title: Training-Trajectory-Aware Token Selection
summary: Efficient distillation is a key pathway for converting expensive reasoning capability into deployable efficiency, yet in the frontier regime where the student already has strong reasoning ability, naive continual distillation often yields limited gains or even degradation. We observe a characteristic training phenomenon: even as loss decreases monotonically, all performance metrics can drop sharply at almost the same bottleneck, before gradually recovering. We further uncover a token-level mechanism: confidence bifurcates into steadily increasing Imitation-Anchor Tokens that quickly anchor optimization and other yet-to-learn tokens whose confidence is suppressed until after the bottleneck. And the characteristic that these two types of tokens cannot coexist is the root cause of the failure in continual distillation. To this end, we propose Training-Trajectory-Aware Token Selection (T3S) to reconstruct the training objective at the token level, clearing the optimization path for yet-to-learn tokens. T3 yields consistent gains in both AR and dLLM settings: with only hundreds of examples, Qwen3-8B surpasses DeepSeek-R1 on competitive reasoning benchmarks, Qwen3-32B approaches Qwen3-235B, and T3-trained LLaDA-2.0-Mini exceeds its AR baseline, achieving state-of-the-art performance among all of 16B-scale no-think models.

AI.tldr: 提出一种名为T3S（Training-Trajectory-Aware Token Selection）的方法，通过在 token 层面重构训练目标，解决现有模型蒸馏在处理高能力学生模型时遇到的性能瓶颈问题，并在多个推理基准上取得了显著的性能提升。
AI.motivation: 现有的持续蒸馏方法在学生模型本身具备较强推理能力时，往往效果不佳甚至导致性能下降。研究者观察到一种训练现象：在训练过程中，所有性能指标可能在某个瓶颈点急剧下降后缓慢恢复。
AI.method: T3S 方法通过分析 token 级别的置信度变化，发现 Imitation-Anchor Tokens 和 yet-to-learn tokens 之间的不兼容性是持续蒸馏失败的根本原因。T3S 旨在重建 token 级别的训练目标，为 yet-to-learn tokens 清除优化路径。
AI.result: 在 AR 和 dLLM 设置下，T3S 均取得了持续的性能提升。例如，仅用数百个样本，Qwen3-8B 在推理基准上超越了 DeepSeek-R1；Qwen3-32B 的性能接近 Qwen3-235B；T3 训练的 LLaDA-2.0-Mini 性能超越了其 AR 基线模型，并在 16B 参数规模的“no-think”模型中达到 SOTA。
AI.conclusion: T3S 是一种有效的 token 级别训练策略，能够克服现有持续蒸馏方法的局限性，有效提升高能力学生模型的推理性能，并在多个标准上展现出优越性。

title: Are Language Models Models?
comment: 5 pages. This is an invited commentary under review at Behavioral and Brain Sciences
summary: Futrell and Mahowald claim LMs "serve as model systems", but an assessment at each of Marr's three levels suggests the claim is clearly not true at the implementation level, poorly motivated at the algorithmic-representational level, and problematic at the computational theory level. LMs are good candidates as tools; calling them cognitive models overstates the case and unnecessarily feeds LLM hype.

AI.tldr: 该论文评估了大型语言模型（LLM）作为认知模型的能力，认为它们在实现、算法和计算理论层面都存在不足，并建议将其定位为工具而非认知模型，以避免夸大其词并助长LLM的炒作。
AI.motivation: 评估Futrell和Mahowald关于大型语言模型（LLM）作为认知模型主张的有效性，特别是从Marr的三个理论层面（计算理论、算法-表示和实现）进行考察。
AI.method: 采用Marr的三层理论框架（计算理论、算法-表示、实现）来评估LLM作为认知模型的适用性。
AI.result: 在实现层面，LLM作为认知模型的说法不成立；在算法-表示层面，该说法动机不足；在计算理论层面，该说法存在问题。
AI.conclusion: LLM是很好的工具，但将其称为认知模型会夸大其能力，并可能助长对LLM的过度炒作。

title: An Efficient Long-Context Ranking Architecture With Calibrated LLM Distillation: Application to Person-Job Fit
summary: Finding the most relevant person for a job proposal in real time is challenging, especially when resumes are long, structured, and multilingual. In this paper, we propose a re-ranking model based on a new generation of late cross-attention architecture, that decomposes both resumes and project briefs to efficiently handle long-context inputs with minimal computational overhead. To mitigate historical data biases, we use a generative large language model (LLM) as a teacher, generating fine-grained, semantically grounded supervision. This signal is distilled into our student model via an enriched distillation loss function. The resulting model produces skill-fit scores that enable consistent and interpretable person-job matching. Experiments on relevance, ranking, and calibration metrics demonstrate that our approach outperforms state-of-the-art baselines.

AI.tldr: 提出了一种基于新一代晚期交叉注意力模型，用于实时招聘匹配，该模型能有效处理长文本简历和项目简报，并利用LLM生成监督信号来解决历史数据偏见，最终模型在相关性、排序和校准方面优于现有方法。
AI.motivation: 实时找到最适合工作的人充满挑战，尤其是当简历冗长、结构复杂且多语言时。
AI.method: 提出了一种基于晚期交叉注意力模型进行重排的模型，该模型将简历和项目简报分解，以低计算开销高效处理长上下文输入。利用生成式大语言模型（LLM）作为教师，生成细粒度、语义化的监督信号，并通过增强的蒸馏损失函数将其蒸馏到学生模型中。
AI.result: 模型能够生成技能匹配分数，实现一致且可解释的人员-职位匹配。实验结果表明，该方法在相关性、排序和校准指标上优于最先进的基线。
AI.conclusion: 该方法能够有效地解决长文本、多语言简历的处理难题，并通过LLM生成监督信号来缓解历史数据偏见，从而在人员-职位匹配任务上取得了更好的性能。

title: CURVE: A Benchmark for Cultural and Multilingual Long Video Reasoning
summary: Recent advancements in video models have shown tremendous progress, particularly in long video understanding. However, current benchmarks predominantly feature western-centric data and English as the dominant language, introducing significant biases in evaluation. To address this, we introduce CURVE (Cultural Understanding and Reasoning in Video Evaluation), a challenging benchmark for multicultural and multilingual video reasoning. CURVE comprises high-quality, entirely human-generated annotations from diverse, region-specific cultural videos across 18 global locales. Unlike prior work that relies on automatic translations, CURVE provides complex questions, answers, and multi-step reasoning steps, all crafted in native languages. Making progress on CURVE requires a deeply situated understanding of visual cultural context. Furthermore, we leverage CURVE's reasoning traces to construct evidence-based graphs and propose a novel iterative strategy using these graphs to identify fine-grained errors in reasoning. Our evaluations reveal that SoTA Video-LLMs struggle significantly, performing substantially below human-level accuracy, with errors primarily stemming from the visual perception of cultural elements. CURVE will be publicly available under https://github.com/google-deepmind/neptune?tab=readme-ov-file\#minerva-cultural
